title: Sebastiano Antonio Pighini
text:
Sebastiano Antonio Pighini (17 September 1500 – 23 November 1553) was an <a href="Italians">Italian</a> <a href="Catholic%20Church">Roman 
Catholic</a> <a href="Bishop%20%28Catholic%20Church%29">bishop</a> and <a href="Cardinal%20%28Catholicism%29">cardinal</a>.
Biography.
Sebastiano Antonio Pighini was born in Arceto, near <a href="Scandiano">Scandiano</a>, on 17 September 1500, the son of Grazio Pighini and Caterina Vigarani.
After studying <a href="law">law</a>, he became a cleric at <a href="Reggio%20Emilia">Reggio Emilia</a>. He was also a <a href="Canon%20%28priest%29">canon</a> of the <a href="cathedral%20chapter">cathedral chapter</a> of <a href="Capua%20Cathedral">Capua Cathedral</a>.
Moving to <a href="Rome">Rome</a>, he became an <a href="Auditor%20%28ecclesiastical%29">auditor</a> of the <a href="Roman%20Rota">Roman Rota</a> and a <a href="Chaplain%20of%20His%20Holiness">Chaplain of His Holiness</a>. He also served as <a href="internuncio">internuncio</a> to <a href="Charles%20V%2C%20Holy%20Roman%20Emperor">Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor</a>.
On 27 August 1546 he was elected <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Diocese%20of%20Alife-Caiazzo">Bishop of Alife</a>. He was <a href="Consecration">consecrated</a> as a <a href="Bishop%20%28Catholic%20Church%29">bishop</a> in <a href="Trento%20Cathedral">Trento Cathedral</a> on 21 December 1546 by Cardinal <a href="Pope%20Julius%20III">Giovanni Maria Ciocchi del Monte</a>. He took his seat at the <a href="Council%20of%20Trent">Council of Trent</a> on 13 January 1547. When the Council moved to <a href="Bologna">Bologna</a>, he served as its president from 12 March 1547 until 10 November 1549. On 4 June 1548 he was transferred to the <a href="Diocese%20of%20Ferentino">see of Ferentino</a>, and then, on 30 May 1550, promoted to the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Archdiocese%20of%20Manfredonia-Vieste-S.%20Giovanni%20Rotondo">metropolitan see of Manfredonia</a>. He served as full <a href="nuncio">nuncio</a> to Emperor Charles V August 1550 to April 1551. He was also a <a href="Apostolic%20Dataria">Datary</a> from 1550 to 1552.
<a href="Pope%20Julius%20III">Pope Julius III</a> made him a <a href="cardinal%20priest">cardinal priest</a> in the <a href="Papal%20consistory">consistory</a> of 20 November 1551; published in the consistory of 30 May 1552. He received the <a href="Galero">red hat</a> and the <a href="titular%20church">titular church</a> of <a href="San%20Callisto">San Callisto</a> on 27 June 1552. He was made papal <a href="vicar">vicar</a> over all the tribunals of Rome. On 11 December 1553 he was named administrator of the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Diocese%20of%20Adria-Rovigo">see of Adria</a>.
He died in Rome on 23 November 1553. He was buried in <a href="Santa%20Maria%20del%20Popolo">Santa Maria del Popolo</a>.
